title: AudioManager.load_music
description: Loads a music track into memory so it can be played later.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the music file to load

title: AudioManager.load_sound
description: Loads a sound effect into memory and assigns it a name for later use.
usage:
from VertexEngine.audio import AudioManager

AudioManager.load_sound(name, path)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to assign to the loaded sound

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the sound file to load

title: AudioManager.play_music
description: Plays the previously loaded music track. Loops specify how many times to repeat; -1 loops forever.

parameters.name: loops
parameters.description: Number of times to repeat playback; -1 for infinite looping

title: AudioManager.play_sound
description: Plays a previously loaded sound effect. Loops specify how many times to repeat playback.
usage:
from VertexEngine.audio import AudioManager

AudioManager.play_sound(name, loops=0)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the loaded sound to play

parameters.name: loops
parameters.description: Number of times to repeat playback

title: AudioManager.stop_music
description: Stops the currently playing music immediately.

title: AssetManager.get_image
description: Retrieves a previously loaded image by its assigned name from the asset manager.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name assigned to the loaded image

title: AssetManager.load_image
description: Loads an image into the asset manager and assigns it a name for later retrieval or display.
usage:
from VertexEngine.assets import AssetManager

AssetManager.load_image(name, path)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name to assign to the loaded image

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the image file to load

title: VertexScreen.Draw.rect
description: Draws a solid-colored rectangle on the given surface. Optionally specify the rectangle area.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.rect(surface, color, rect)

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of the rectangle (RGB or RGBA)

title: VertexScreen.Draw.polygon
description: Draws a polygon on the surface by connecting a series of points. Width controls line thickness.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.polygon(surface, color, points, width)

title: VertexScreen.Draw.circle
signature: VertexScreen.Draw.circle(surface, color, center, radius, width, draw_top_right, draw_top_left, draw_bottom_right, draw_bottom_left)
description: Draws a circle on the given surface with configurable corners, radius, width, and color.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.circle(surface, color, center, radius, width, True, True, True, True)

parameters.name: draw_top_right
parameters.description: Whether to draw the top-right quarter

parameters.name: draw_top_left
parameters.description: Whether to draw the top-left quarter

parameters.name: draw_bottom_right
parameters.description: Whether to draw the bottom-right quarter

parameters.name: draw_bottom_left
parameters.description: Whether to draw the bottom-left quarter

title: VertexScreen.Draw.ellipse
description: Draws an ellipse inside the specified rectangle area on the surface.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.ellipse(surface, color, rect, width)

parameters.name: rect
parameters.description: Rectangle coordinates (x, y, width, height) to contain the ellipse

title: VertexScreen.Draw.arc
signature: VertexScreen.Draw.arc(surface, color, rect, start_angle, stop_angle, width)
description: Draws an arc within the given rectangle from start_angle to stop_angle with specified width and color.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.arc(surface, color, rect, start_angle, stop_angle, width)

parameters.name: rect
parameters.description: Rectangle area to contain the arc

title: VertexScreen.Draw.line
description: Draws a straight line between start_pos and end_pos on the surface.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.line(surface, color, start_pos, end_pos, width)

title: VertexScreen.Draw.lines
description: Draws multiple connected lines defined by points. Can optionally close the shape.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.lines(surface, color, closed, points, width)

parameters.name: closed
parameters.description: Whether to close the shape by connecting last point to first

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: List of points for the lines

title: VertexScreen.Draw.aaline
description: Draws an anti-aliased (smooth) line between start_pos and end_pos.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.aaline(surface, color, start_pos, end_pos, blend)

parameters.name: blend
parameters.description: Whether to blend with background for anti-aliasing

title: VertexScreen.Draw.aalines
description: Draws multiple anti-aliased (smooth) lines defined by points. Can optionally close the shape.
usage:
from VertexEngine import VertexScreen

vs = VertexScreen()
vs.Draw.aalines(surface, color, closed, points, blend)

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: List of points for the lines

parameters.name: blend
parameters.description: Whether to blend with background for anti-aliasing
